name: Peter O'Toole Movies Online Trivia | People Themed | 10 Questions

questions.text: O'Toole was great as the troubled king in "Becket"; co-star Richard Burton was equally superb in the title role. Which statement about the movie's end is true?
questions.correct: The King lives, but Becket dies
options: Becket lives, but the King dies
questions.explanation:
The King lives, but Becket dies.

	It's always enjoyable to see two strong actors at the top of their game. Friendship is often tricky - especially if it's between a king and his best friend (who becomes Archbishop).

questions.text: O'Toole is equally well-known for his excellent performance in the title role in "Lawrence of Arabia". Who directed this sprawling epic?
questions.explanation:
David Lean.

	This movie is a bit long, but still manages to hold one's interest. (T.E. Lawrence - as played by O'Toole - must have ben quite an interesting fellow.) Unlike "Becket", O'Toole doesn't share the screen here with an equal co-star; he alone dominates the movie.

questions.text: O'Toole again played a British Monarch in "The Lion in Winter". What legendary actress also starred in the movie?
questions.explanation:
Katharine Hepburn.

	O'Toole and Hepburn are always commanding to watch. (Be that as it may, I'm not as impressed by this movie as many other people seem to be.)

questions.text: On a lighter note, O'Toole starred in "My Favorite Year". This comedy was said to be based on the actual experiences of what movie star?
questions.explanation:
Errol Flynn.

	Live TV was filled with pitfalls: anything could happen. It was apparently quite a task to keep veteran hellraiser Errol Flynn out of trouble and in suitable condition to perform. O'Toole's movie star character is said to be based on Flynn's "Wicked, Wicked Ways".

questions.text: "Masada" was also a fact-based tale. What ancient civilization was involved in the story?
questions.explanation:
Rome.

	This was another tale of religious confrontation set in ancient Rome. The movie co-starred Peter Strauss.

questions.text: O'Toole was one of the stars of "Rosebud". The movie (which didn't do particularly well) was interesting for one unusual reason: a former New York political figure tried his hand at acting by appearing in the movie. Who was this man?
questions.correct: Former Mayor of New York City
options: Former Governor of New York State
Former Senator from New York State
questions.explanation:
Former Mayor of New York City.

	Former New York City mayor John V. Lindsay briefly tried his hand at acting after his days as mayor were completed. (He also briefly considered a run for the presidency.) Neither idea worked out.

questions.text: O'Toole also starred in "Goodbye, Mr. Chips". Who was Chips?
questions.explanation:
Teacher.

	O'Toole is one of many to portray this legendary educator.

questions.text: O'Toole starred in the movie version of the novel, "Night of the Generals". Which statement accurately describes the movie's setting?
questions.explanation:
World War II.

	Based on a novel by Hans Helmut Kirst, this movie involves a wartime murder. Several members of the German High Command are suspects.

questions.text: O'Toole starred in "Lord Jim". Who wrote the novel on which the film was based?
questions.explanation:
Joseph Conrad.

	Conrad is better known these days for "Heart of Darkness" (which transformed into "Apocalypse Now").

questions.text: Which of the following movies stars Peter O'Toole?
questions.explanation:
The Ruling Class.

	"Ruling Class" was a comic vehicle for O'Toole. "Ryan" had David Lean as director, but starred Robert Mitchum. "John Doe" starred Gary Cooper (and Barbara Stanwyck). "Taras Bulba" starred Tony Curtis and Yul Brynner.
